prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system: 1. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0]. 2. Set the Translation Vector to [0.0, 0.2421, 0.0]. Now, create the 2D sketch on the X-Y plane: 1. Create a new face (face_1) on the X-Y plane. 2. Draw the first line (line_1) with a start point at [0.0, 0.0] and an end point at [0.4247, 0.0]. 3. Draw the second line (line_2) with a start point at [0.4247, 0.0] and an end point at [0.4247, 0.75]. 4. Draw the third line (line_3) with a start point at [0.4247, 0.75] and an end point at [0.0, 0.75]. 5. Draw the fourth line (line_4) with a start point at [0.0, 0.75] and an end point at [0.0, 0.0]. The loop (loop_1) consists of 4 lines: 1. line_1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.4247, 0.0] 2. line_2: [0.4247, 0.0] to [0.4247, 0.75] 3. line_3: [0.4247, 0.75] to [0.0, 0.75] 4. line_4: [0.0, 0.75] to [0.0, 0.0] Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch: 1. Apply the rotation represented by the Euler angles (0.0, 0.0, -90.0 degrees) around the Z-axis, then the Y-axis, and then the X-axis. 2. Apply the translation vector [0.0, 0.2421, 0.0]. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model: 1. Extrude the sketch by a depth of 0.2421 towards the normal and 0.0 in the opposite direction. 2. Scale the sketch by 0.75. The resulting prism has the following dimensions: - Height: 0.75 - Width: 0.2421 - Length: 0.75</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Constructing a Tapered Rectangular Prism** Construct a tapered rectangular prism. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin with no rotation. **1.1 Sketching the Tapered Rectangular Prism** Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. 1.1.1 Draw the first line from `(0, 0)` to `(0.75, 0)`. 1.1.2 Draw the second line from `(0.75, 0)` to `(0.75, 0.75)`. 1.1.3 Draw the third line from `(0.75, 0.75)` to `(0, 0.75)`. 1.1.4 Draw the fourth line from `(0, 0.75)` to `(0, 0)`. Close the loop to complete the sketch. **1.2 Extruding the Tapered Rectangular Prism** Extrude the 2D sketch to a 3D model. 1.2.1 Extrude the sketch along the Z-axis by `0.075` units. 1.2.2 Set the sketch scale to `0.75` for the extrusion. 1.2.3 Define a new solid body for the extruded shape. **Part 2: Constructing a Set of Nine Rectangular Prisms** Construct a set of nine rectangular prisms, with varying lengths and orientations. **2.1 Sketching the Nine Rectangular Prisms** Create a new coordinate system at `(0.075, 0.075, 0.075)` with no rotation. 2.1.1 Draw the first rectangular prism sketch on the X-Y plane. - First line: `(0, 0)` to `(0.15, 0)` - Second line: `(0.15, 0)` to `(0.15, 0.15)` - Third line: `(0.15, 0.15)` to `(0, 0.15)` - Fourth line: `(0, 0.15)` to `(0, 0)` 2.1.2 Draw the second rectangular prism sketch on the X-Y plane, translating it `0.3` units along the X-axis. - First line: `(0.3, 0)` to `(0.45, 0)` - Second line: `(0.45, 0)` to `(0.45, 0.15)` - Third line: `(0.45, 0.15)` to `(0.3, 0.15)` - Fourth line: `(0.3, 0.15)` to `(0.3, 0)` 2.1.3 Create six additional rectangular prism sketches, spaced equally in the X and Y directions, on the X-Y plane. Close all loops to complete the sketches. **2.2 Extruding the Nine Rectangular Prisms** Extrude all nine 2D sketches along the Z-axis with varying extrusion depths. 2.2.1 Extrude the first and fourth sketches by `0.45` units. 2.2.2 Extrude the second and fifth sketches by `0.3` units. 2.2.3 Extrude the third and sixth sketches by `0.15` units. 2.2.4 Extrude the seventh and eighth sketches by `0.6` units. 2.2.5 Extrude the ninth sketch by `0.45` units. Join all the extruded shapes into one solid body. Final Shape: Based on the provided `description`, the final shape should be a 3D model of a rectangular prism with four cylindrical holes aligned vertically along its length. The holes should be evenly spaced and have a smaller diameter than the prism. The prism should be centered on a white background. Its dimensions are: - Length: 0.75 + 0.3 + 0.15 + 0.6 = 1.85 units - Width: 0.75 + 0.15 + 0.45 + 0.15 + 0.6 = 2.1 units - Height: 0.075 + maximum extrusion depth (0.45 or 0.6) = 0.525 to 0.675 units (approx.)</description>

The dimensions are approximately 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] 2. Draw the 2D sketch on the XY plane of the created coordinate system with the following components: Face 1: - Loop 1: - Line 1: (0.0, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.0) - Line 2: (0.75, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.25) - Line 3: (0.75, 0.25) to (0.625, 0.25) - Line 4: (0.625, 0.25) to (0.625, 0.125) - Line 5: (0.625, 0.125) to (0.5, 0.125) - Line 6: (0.5, 0.125) to (0.5, 0.25) - Line 7: (0.5, 0.25) to (0.0, 0.25) - Line 8: (0.0, 0.25) to (0.0, 0.0) Ensure that the loop is closed. 3. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. 4. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the coordinate system parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] 5. Extrude the 3D sketch with the following properties: - Extrude depth towards normal: 0.0 - Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.375 - Sketch scale: 0.75 - Operation: Create a new solid body The final dimensions of the part are approximately 2 units by 3 units by 4 units (height, width, length).</description>
